content: this year i have the great honor to be one of four ambassadors for granny square day 2022 gsd 2022 as an ambassador i was asked to create a granny square that represents something about my life i have a huge love for the nature and immediatly knew i wanted to make a square with a flower flowers comes in all shapes and colors with a range from petite sheer and soft colored to big bold with vivid colors and i love them all my square oriental bloom square is made with rich colors that makes me happy the flower has a textured center and petals that stands up the petals are perfect for little fingers to fidget on if you fancy making a baby blanket around the flower is a 3d frame that also creates a beautiful pattern when several squares are joined togeter as with all granny squares you can use this square to make anything you fancy a bag throw scarf table cloth cushion cardigan wallhanging etc depending on what yarn you use the look and feeling will change use your favorite yarn and make your favorite flower i used the yarn scheepjes catona 100% mercerised cotton for my oriental bloom square the catona yarn comes in 113 colors and i´m sure you can find your favorites among them i used the colors 383 ginger gold 413 cherry 517 ruby and 391 deep ocean how to place your colors are described in the pattern i wanted a firm square and used hook 3 0 mm but if you like a softer square use 3 5 mm the size of the square depends on which yarn and hook you use but my square measures 11 5 x 11 5 cm after blocking i hope that you will enjoy this pattern as much i did designing it if you post pictures in social media you can use #mijocrochet #orientalbloomsquare and #grannysquareday2022 to make it easier to find your picture **pattern features ** * written pattern in english us and uk terminology danish dutch german greek russian slovak spanish and swedish * photo tutorials to show the neccesary steps of the pattern * stitch count * information about yarn and colordistribution **stitches used in this pattern us terms ** slip_stitch back post slip_stitch * chain s single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet back post double_crochet * treble puff stitches marked with an * are described in my stitch guide always available on my blog mijocrochet se 1 **join my facebook group ** my facebook group mijo crochet hangout 2 is a place where you can get support ask questions share pictures and socialize with other fellow crocheters ❀❀❀ this pattern have been fully tested many thanks to kathy haire for your great help with this pattern ❀❀❀ due to
